recently live migration object model changed makes the object need to be
registered in order to be communicated within nova conductor and compute and
other nova services, Without register through objects.__init__.register_all
, it can't be used. And the base class 'LiveMigrationObject' is not registered
so it can't be used either.

This patch added basic class for zvm live migration object, it won't affect
other functions at all and the only change in test is the test object hash change.

as zvm is not in tree yet, so I didn't add unit test for it, it can be added
per request.

commit_message:
add zvm migration object

zvm is a out of tree driver which we want to be in tree in the future
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/nova-zvm-virt-driver,n,z

zvm have CI here:
http://extbasicopstackcilog01.w3-969.ibm.com/test_logs/

recently live migration object model changed makes the object need to be
registered in order to be communicated within nova conductor and compute and
other nova services, Without register through objects.__init__.register_all
, it can't be used. And the base class 'LiveMigrationObject' is not registered
so it can't be used either.

This patch added basic class for zvm live migration object, it won't affect
other functions at all and the only change in test is the test object hash change.

as zvm is not in tree yet, so I didn't add unit test for it, it can be added
per request.

Change-Id: I352ea99d0e90212e65f9c1b738e45a8e3ebb596d

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40190

Closes-Bug: #1886298

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal

Change-Id: I602c3ce7c94a039e3fd550cbb47a8e8f095aacea

commit_message:
Fix the lower-constraints job for focal

The move to focal for the tox jobs has raised issues with package
versions supporting python 3.8.
This patch bumps the version for the following packages:
cffi==1.14.0
cryptography==3.0
pyOpenSSL==19.1.0

Change-Id: I72c7bdd07a0b571fea01f76d8579a8d84057ebf8

Implement missing security context template for daemonjob-controller

This change adds security context template at container level

Change-Id: I72b1d5678e1fd3464b73937a2c50362bde8ae1d5

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Allow logical disk labels to change for Ceph OSD disks

This change allows Ceph OSDs to respond to logical disk changes
and continue to function instead of failing to initialize after
such a change. For example, /dev/sdd is deployed as an OSD disk
and then subsequently becomes /dev/sde due to a hardware-related
event. This change allows the OSD to adapt and run as /dev/sde.

Change-Id: I6c22088b8d884f9dd300d026415fb126af4b41d4

[{'created': '2020-09-10 17:06:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0455629e5231032186465c401c3ec86e6beb22c5
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0455629e5231032186465c401c3ec86e6beb22c5

commit_message:
Use KSA loading to support more auth methods

Currently Blazar has hard-coded support for only two login methods:
'token' and 'password'. There are many more auth mechanisms supported by
Keystone and the clients. The complexity of parsing arguments and
constructing an auth/session entity is taken care of in the
keystoneauth1.loading module, which this commit takes advantage of.

Change-Id: I7173d1880c8938ac54a0fb3495417f5ce40db4e7

commit_message:
Add logic for event_update handling and set transfer event as event_update

This patch implements logic for updating resources in gnocchi when an
event_update happens. Additionally, it adds volume.transfer events to
the event_definitions.yaml and attributes for said event in
gnocchi_resources.yaml

Change-Id: I15bc4e1589f92fc856876a563122c1a1e07d4c4a
(cherry picked from commit aa6b4e86421312665155485e0018643939f48572)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-09 19:29:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add TCP listener on OVSDB

Per [1], Nova expects the local OVSDB server to listen to TCP port 6640
on localhost. This patch adds the default var neutron_ovsdb_manager and
creates a TCP listener on the OVN controller/compute, if needed.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1852200

Change-Id: Id9573af6a0d533e74af6cd4cf9c32e4088fa5e79
'}]
commit_message:
Add TCP listener on OVSDB

Per [1], Nova expects the local OVSDB server to listen to TCP port 6640
on localhost. This patch adds the default var neutron_ovsdb_manager and
creates a TCP listener on the OVN controller/compute, if needed.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1852200

Change-Id: Id9573af6a0d533e74af6cd4cf9c32e4088fa5e79

commit_message:
functional: Use tempdir for CONF.instances_path

This was being set in an ad-hoc manner throughout the code, but it's
necessary for all kinds of live migration and evacuation operations.
Just centralize the configuration.

Change-Id: Iab455e22aa075bb1b3fb9b7d1870b1eb7314e320
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-19 14:49:59.000000000', 'message': "functional: Add 'start_compute' helper

Change Id3f77c4ecccfdc4caa6dbf120c3df4fbdfce9d0f added the
'start_computes' function as a helper to start multiple compute hosts
with different 'HostInfo' objects. Unfortunately, there are cases where
you might also want to start multiple computes with e.g. different
'PCIInfo' objects and this can't handle those cases. We could expand the
'host_info_dict' parameter to transition from a mapping of hostnames ->
HostInfo objects to a mapping of hostnames -> HostInfo and PCIInfo
objects, but after a while that gets frankly quite ridiculous. Instead,
replace 'start_computes' with 'start_compute', a new helper that can
handle creating a new service with its own unique 'HostInfo' and various
other attributes currently accepted by the '_get_connection' helper.
This allows us to remove 'start_computes' in its entirety.

Change-Id: I79a16a0a62c6060cd3062174ce68fd8cbde9f3fc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-08-24 15:12:31.000000000', 'message': "functional: Add 'start_compute' helper

commit_message:
functional: Add 'start_compute' helper

Change Id3f77c4ecccfdc4caa6dbf120c3df4fbdfce9d0f added the
'start_computes' function as a helper to start multiple compute hosts
with different 'HostInfo' objects. Unfortunately, there are cases where
you might also want to start multiple computes with e.g. different
'PCIInfo' objects and this can't handle those cases. We could expand the
'host_info_dict' parameter to transition from a mapping of hostnames ->
HostInfo objects to a mapping of hostnames -> HostInfo and PCIInfo
objects, but after a while that gets frankly quite ridiculous. Instead,
replace 'start_computes' with 'start_compute', a new helper that can
handle creating a new service with its own unique 'HostInfo' and various
other attributes currently accepted by the '_get_connection' helper.
This allows us to remove 'start_computes' in its entirety.

Change-Id: I79a16a0a62c6060cd3062174ce68fd8cbde9f3fc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: Pause image builds on nb03.openstack.org
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-09-09 22:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-09-10 17:12:37.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nnb03.openstack.org is already paused and is currently in the emergency hosts list so isn't managed."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-09 22:16:50.000000000', 'message': 'Pause image builds on nb03.openstack.org

We want to delete nb03.openstack.org but doing so would "leak" the
images it has built in the linaro-us cloud. We can address taht by
pausing all image builds on this builder, then ask nodepool to delete
all of the images nb03.openstack.org has built. Once it is done cleaning
up after itself we can delete the server itself and remove its config
management.

Change-Id: I498472307e2b9cc9a8c9494152464c4b57672b6c
'}]
commit_message:
Pause image builds on nb03.openstack.org

We want to delete nb03.openstack.org but doing so would "leak" the
images it has built in the linaro-us cloud. We can address taht by
pausing all image builds on this builder, then ask nodepool to delete
all of the images nb03.openstack.org has built. Once it is done cleaning
up after itself we can delete the server itself and remove its config
management.

Change-Id: I498472307e2b9cc9a8c9494152464c4b57672b6c

subject: Fixup failing tests due to passing date threshold
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-27 21:19:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fixup failing tests due to passing date threshold

Some of the tests rely on a hard-coded date being actually in the past
when the test runs. This fixes that by fixing the value of utctime when
the test executes to a date in the past relative to the test input.

Change-Id: Iccb57dca5c1130a0e6ca88e9ca387fc218891369
'}]
commit_message:
Fixup failing tests due to passing date threshold

Some of the tests rely on a hard-coded date being actually in the past
when the test runs. This fixes that by fixing the value of utctime when
the test executes to a date in the past relative to the test input.

Change-Id: Iccb57dca5c1130a0e6ca88e9ca387fc218891369

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-23 16:40:19.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Add HW_CPU_X86_* traits for Meltdown/Spectre mitigation

These important CPU flags provide mitigation from Meltdown and Spectre
flaws.  They are to be used on Intel and AMD x86 hosts, when available
in the host CPU.

Two related points:

  - These CPU features need to be explicitly enabled when using a
    ``custom`` CPU mode, as they are not included by default in some of
    the "named CPU models" (e.g. Intel "Broadwell" or AMD "EPYC") by
    libvirt/QEMU.

  - However, all these CPU features will be automatically included in
    the guest CPU model when using the CPU mode ``host-passthrough`` or
    ``host-model`` (Nova's default).

Source:
    https://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=blob;f=docs/qemu-cpu-models.texi

And its HTML-rendered version:
    https://qemu.weilnetz.de/doc/qemu-doc.html#recommendations_005fcpu_005fmodels_005fx86

Change-Id: I11a3e7b270947700b9a25470ac9082fd1cc257a4
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-04-24 11:45:02.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Add HW_CPU_X86_* traits for Meltdown/Spectre mitigation

These important CPU flags provide mitigation from Meltdown and Spectre
flaws.  They are to be used on Intel and AMD x86 hosts, when available
in the host CPU.

    libvirt/QEMU.

  - However, all these CPU features will be automatically included in
    the guest CPU model when using the CPU mode ``host-passthrough`` or

Source:
    https://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=blob;f=docs/qemu-cpu-models.texi

And its HTML-rendered version:
    https://qemu.weilnetz.de/doc/qemu-doc.html#recommendations_005fcpu_005fmodels_005fx86

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655193

Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Add HW_CPU_X86_* traits for Meltdown/Spectre mitigation

These important CPU flags provide mitigation from Meltdown and Spectre
flaws.  They are to be used on Intel and AMD x86 hosts, when available
in the host CPU.

Two related points:

  - These CPU features need to be explicitly enabled when using a
    ``custom`` CPU mode, as they are not included by default in some of
    the "named CPU models" (e.g. Intel "Broadwell" or AMD "EPYC") by
    libvirt/QEMU.

  - However, all these CPU features will be automatically included in
    the guest CPU model when using the CPU mode ``host-passthrough`` or
    ``host-model`` (Nova's default).

Source:
    https://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=blob;f=docs/qemu-cpu-models.texi

And its HTML-rendered version:
    https://qemu.weilnetz.de/doc/qemu-doc.html#recommendations_005fcpu_005fmodels_005fx86

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655193

Change-Id: I11a3e7b270947700b9a25470ac9082fd1cc257a4
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

This is the sort of change that probably warrants a blueprint or spec because it is a fairly big change for how the vmware driver works. Exposing it solely via a config option and a release note is not enough.

Also I recall that at some point it was either like this or similar to this and a decision was made that this is not the preferred way to talk to vsphere (despite some obvious advantage for _some_ use cases).

Given how much time has passed since any changes made in this stack, it might be that this is dead, and should be abandoned. If not, it is probably worth starting a conversation about it with the community to see if the change is desired.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-10 16:54:19.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This has been open with negative comments for nearly two years now. I'm going to abandon this for now. Please reopen if this is still important"}]

commit_message:
VMware: Expose esx hosts to Openstack

Making ESX hosts visible as hypervisors in Openstack so we can
get more concrete information about a virtual machine.

Change-Id: I5b3d42c76c35ce9c2ffb1301b4a94d1f1796117b

commit_message:
Remove experimental job legacy-tempest-dsvm-zeromq-multibackend

The devstack-plugin-zeromq is retired, see
https://review.opendev.org/748700. Remove this experimental job
to fix Zuul configuration.

Change-Id: I37c028ab063ec9127f02dd479cae49da8bffb11b

commit_message:
On branch vm-query-notsameproject

Blueprint query diff user's vm in the same project. in the same project,
user a is leader, and group member is b and c ,
they all can creates vm. The requirement is that user b cannot query the vm
 created by user c unless the vm created by user c is authorized to user b.

Blueprint vm-query-notsameproject

Change-Id: I13c3943484424defea08b85ea5111534e690d28a

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2019-10-10 09:25:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

There should probably be a release note for this.

Also, I'm a bit torn on considering adding features to libvirt+xen since there has been no active 3rd party CI for this driver configuration in a long time (since Citrix dropped the CI), so I'm hesitant to pile on more features when nothing is doing integration testing on it. On the other hand, it looks like you're a casual first time contributor and the lack of 3rd party CI for this driver configuration is not your fault and thus I'm not sure we should punish you for it if this is something you rely on and this is a relatively simple change. I'm just mentioning it, but my -1 isn't for it, it's for the lack of (1) release note and (2) assuming we need a min libvirt version check in the code.

For info on release notes:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/releasenotes.html"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-10 14:44:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Unfortunately we've made the decision to deprecate support for the libvirt+Xen driver, along with any other non-QEMU/KVM libvirt drivers, this cycle. This is due to lack of maintenance and a reduced number of reviewers available to review patches like this. Given the feature is deprecated, it doesn't really make sense to merge this as is. Apologies. If you or your organization are interested in the libvirt+Xen combination, I'd encourage you to bring it up on the openstack-discuss mailing list. commit_message:
Add support for Xen PVH VM Mode in libvirt driver

Starting with Xen 4.10 [1] and libvirt 4.10 [2], one can chose PVH as a virtual
machine mode using "xenpvh" OS type from libvirt.

[1] https://wiki.xenproject.org/wiki/Xen_Project_4.10_Feature_List#PVHv2_DomU
[2] https://libvirt.org/news.html#v4.10.0

Change-Id: I8603154f2cde850b6398b419e203a725c374d001
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Belouin <nicolas.belouin@gandi.net>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I0fdaa5f2095d55221336212332d644d256c0c2c7
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Nova handle empty vcpu_pin_set scenario

This commit is for robustness purpose.
Now when empty 'vcpu_pin_set' is configured(e.g. ""), or an actual
empty 'vcpu_pin_set' is configured(e.g. "1-3,^1,^2,^3"), due to
mis-configuration or any other reason, nova will treat the empty
set as full set.

When mis-configuration happens, this behavior is very dangerous, and
hard to trouble-shoot. It's make sense that nova refuse any VM to
start on this compute node.

Closes-Bug: #1579664
Change-Id: I8b6afb19c1b259acf9a0cc04d183399c0021ed00

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-04 10:06:41.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Remove support for Intel CMT `perf` events

In Change-Id I7e77f8765 (commit fc4794acc6 — libvirt: Deprecate support
for monitoring Intel CMT `perf` events, 2018-05-08), we deprecated
support for the Intel CMT events.  We said:

    "[...] Given that the underlying Linux kernel infrastructure for
    Intel CMT is removed, we should remove support for it in Nova too.
    Otherwise enabling them in Nova, and updating to a Linux kernel 4.14
    (or above) will result in instances failing to boot."

Make good on the promise.  We're late, because in the deprecation note
we said that that we'll be removing it in Stein.  But as the cliché
goes, "better late ..." [you know how it finishes].

In this change:

 - Remove the no-longer needed libvirt code and needless tests
 - In the `perf` related tests, replace the CMT events (used as
   examples) with those that are still supported.  (I picked
   'cpu_cycles' and 'instructions' from here:
   https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsPerf)

        * * *

Note to self: Poll the 'openstack-discuss' list to see if you can learn
the answer to the question I wondered in Change-Id I7e77f8765: "Whether
anyone is using those other events with Nova is a good question to which
we don't have an equally good answer for, if at all."

If we can get data that no one is using the other, non-CMT, `perf` events
with Nova, then we can get rid of more dead code.

Change-Id: I74981ad629311cbe738563f101b0776ba3d0b049
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Remove support for Intel CMT `perf` events

In Change-Id I7e77f8765 (commit fc4794acc6 — libvirt: Deprecate support
for monitoring Intel CMT `perf` events, 2018-05-08), we deprecated
support for the Intel CMT events.  We said:

    "[...] Given that the underlying Linux kernel infrastructure for
    Intel CMT is removed, we should remove support for it in Nova too.
    Otherwise enabling them in Nova, and updating to a Linux kernel 4.14
    (or above) will result in instances failing to boot."

Make good on the promise.  We're late, because in the deprecation note
we said that that we'll be removing it in Stein.  But as the cliché
goes, "better late ..." [you know how it finishes].

In this change:

 - Remove the no-longer needed libvirt code and needless tests
 - In the `perf` related tests, replace the CMT events (used as
   examples) with those that are still supported.  (I picked
   'cpu_cycles' and 'instructions' from here:
   https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsPerf)

        * * *

Note to self: Poll the 'openstack-discuss' list to see if you can learn
the answer to the question I wondered in Change-Id I7e77f8765: "Whether
anyone is using those other events with Nova is a good question to which
we don't have an equally good answer for, if at all."

If we can get data that no one is using the other, non-CMT, `perf` events
with Nova, then we can get rid of more dead code.

Change-Id: I74981ad629311cbe738563f101b0776ba3d0b049
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1885825
Fix user creation with GRANT in MySQL 8.0(Ubuntu Focal)
Ubuntu Focal (20.04) has mysql 8.0 and with mysql 8.0 there
is no implicit user creation with GRANT. We need to
create the user first before using GRANT command.

- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

- Move functional jobs to Focal nodeset

Closes-Bug: #1886298

Story: #2007865
Task: #40222

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal>

Change-Id: I636c3a3b6cd429b1f8df4eaff0cb845ae0f57362

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-03-16 02:31:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Code looks good. I ran it on my env and I'm seeing some weird behavior with both quota set and quota delete operations. Also, considering we changed the expected params, could you update the spec to reflect what it is currently happening? I'm referring to <tenant-id> being a mandatory param now. On the current client we just get the tenant-id from the context. For this client implementation we demand the user to submit the tenant-id. We should clarify this somewhere. I'll keep testing it. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-03-25 20:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Do you need any help here?'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-03-26 08:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-03-26 09:33:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> Do you need any help here?

Thanks Spyros, I rebased the patch and am looking into Victoria's comments now. Will leave questions here as they come up."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-03-26 09:38:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

Excellent work Maari, I'm looking forward to take this and to the next client release.

Cheers!"}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-03-26 10:17:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Code looks good. I ran it on my env and I'm seeing some weird
 > behavior with both quota set and quota delete operations. Also,
 > considering we changed the expected params, could you update the
 > spec to reflect what it is currently happening? I'm referring to
 > <tenant-id> being a mandatory param now. On the current client we
 > just get the tenant-id from the context. For this client
 > implementation we demand the user to submit the tenant-id. We
 > should clarify this somewhere. I'll keep testing it. Thanks!

Thanks for the comments Victoria. I tested it now and I see what you are saying, we are missing the user_id check/validation. Looking into it now"}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-03-26 12:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

If the existing command is wrong already, shall we fix that first?'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-03-26 17:49:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

It seems that retrieving quota per tenant per user is not yet possible on manila. It's a feature not yet implemented and reported in here https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1868088. We do have two options I believe: either we merge the code as is or we change quota show to only take tenant-id or user-id. Since this is a bug present in both the current cli implementation and also in this openstackclient implementation, I'd rather get this merged (since it's ready to go and it has been sitting here for two months already) and then propose a follow up patch fixing this in both implementations."}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-03-26 17:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Thanks Maari!'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-03-26 18:56:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)

Thanks for the hard work on this Maari, I'm not expert on openstack client, so I added a few doubts regarding the quota requests."}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-03-26 19:01:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Code looks good. I ran it on my env and I'm seeing some weird
 > behavior with both quota set and quota delete operations. Also,
 > considering we changed the expected params, could you update the
 > spec to reflect what it is currently happening? I'm referring to
 > <tenant-id> being a mandatory param now. On the current client we
 > just get the tenant-id from the context. For this client
 > implementation we demand the user to submit the tenant-id. We
 > should clarify this somewhere. I'll keep testing it. Thanks!

The first issue that you mentioned is expected, since manila doesn't validated users within keystone. You should be able to retrieve this quotas even for the wrong-id and delete-id aswell.

The second issue looks weird. If you added a tenant/project quota, you should be able to delete and go back to the defaults. The same show occur when you project an user-id, you should be able to change user quota (for a given project) and delete it."}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-03-26 19:04:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> It seems that retrieving quota per tenant per user is not yet
 > possible on manila. It's a feature not yet implemented and reported
 > in here https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1868088. We do have
 > two options I believe: either we merge the code as is or we change
 > quota show to only take tenant-id or user-id. Since this is a bug
 > present in both the current cli implementation and also in this
 > openstackclient implementation, I'd rather get this merged (since
 > it's ready to go and it has been sitting here for two months
 > already) and then propose a follow up patch fixing this in both
 > implementations.

Just clarifying after our conversation. You should be able to set and retrieve quotas for: 1) project, 2) user/project and 3) share-type/project. The bug report points to an undesired behavior when the admin request a quota updated for a wrong user-id (or share-type). Since there are no keystone validadtion, the quota will be stored on manila database and the project quota can affect during a project quota update."}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-03-26 21:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-03-26 22:07:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> (10 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks for the hard work on this Maari, I'm not expert on openstack
 > client, so I added a few doubts regarding the quota requests.

Thanks for the comments, I addressed most of them in patch set 11. Based on the discussion on the manila channel, I left the argument name 'tenant_id' and kept it mandatory as well for now."}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-04-07 16:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-17 08:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Has this missed Ussuri?'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-04-17 22:09:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> Has this missed Ussuri?

Spyros, yes - we'll tag a Victoria release in a few weeks once we've shipped RC, and this will be in that"}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-05-25 12:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Is anyone still working on this?'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-05-25 15:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> Is anyone still working on this?

I will be happy to make any required changes. I think the question about tenant_id being mandatory was kind of left up in the air.'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-05-25 15:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Spyros, what is your take on that? Are you happy with the patch as is, tenant_id being mandatory for all commands?'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-05-26 10:28:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

I don't mind requiring the id, especially when I'm admin.

But, for a user who wants to check their quotas, it might be annoying.
So, for showOne we could take the current project_id/tenant_id."}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-05-30 14:05:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> I don't mind requiring the id, especially when I'm admin.
 > 
 > But, for a user who wants to check their quotas, it might be
 > annoying.
 > So, for showOne we could take the current project_id/tenant_id.

Sure, that makes sense. I just have a follow up question for that, by showOne you mean 'share quota show' or 'share quota default' or both maybe? Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-05-31 21:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(19 comments)

Thank you for your patience with this patch Maari! Sorry about the long turnaround on this review. Please see my comments inline'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-06-01 05:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Workflow-1

> (19 comments)
 > 
 > Thank you for your patience with this patch Maari! Sorry about the
 > long turnaround on this review. Please see my comments inline

Thanks for the review Goutham! I will get started with it :)'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-06-12 14:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-06-13 09:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-06-13 09:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31213, 'date': '2020-06-13 09:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
Implement OSC share quota commands

In this patch we add openstack commands for:
share quota set
share quota show
share quota delete

Change-Id: I3520feec09a6c491f436809a5f620efce1b1f8c2
Partially-implements: bp openstack-client-support

commit_message:
Fix empty metadata exception in Prometheus collector

Metadata defined in metrics.yml may be non-existent in data['metric']
from Prometheus results. Deal with the exception similarly to the
Gnocchi collector.

Change-Id: I02ee50793f3c46050250ca1c4094dd4ef0736ca6
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
Story: 2008123
Task: 40845

commit_message:
Add quantity mutation to Prometheus collector

The Prometheus collector was ignoring the mutate definition from
metrics.yml, which may produce wrong resource ratings.

Change-Id: I662f6ac798c20ca43028b3807fa03aacfdcf252b
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
Story: 2008122
Task: 40844

commit_message:
Use importlib to take place of imp module

The imp module is deprecated[1] since version 3.4, use importlib to
instead

[1]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/imp.html

Change-Id: Ia17bb297be7ef36e351ed4d6bb10fb86f3b63a02

Followups for TLS support

- Fixed a syntax error, and an ordering issue in DIB TLS element
- Removed unneeded deps, since openssl runs on build machine now

Change-Id: Idcdaefdb3aa80fd651ca6de35d18d3581ffe5116

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-20 21:32:44.000000000', 'message': '[goal] Test out Ubuntu Focal nodepool (20.04)

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

This only tests the control plane (devstack) as focal does not
work for amphora images at this time.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40201

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: Ib4a95483a997734788353b6da2a599ca4c2acbbf
'}]
commit_message:
[goal] Test out Ubuntu Focal nodepool (20.04)

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

This only tests the control plane (devstack) as focal does not
work for amphora images at this time.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40201

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: Ib4a95483a997734788353b6da2a599ca4c2acbbf

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-09 15:57:34.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I916be0443735b4574666c34df97fe8acc62ffed2
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I916be0443735b4574666c34df97fe8acc62ffed2

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Icbc3629218546143246c133ccaffaef7bfe0c243
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
[OVN] Move configure_port_forwarding into configure_ovn_plugin

configure_port_forwarding should be done at configure_ovn_plugin,
which is now located at the devstack repo, under ovn_agent.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750809/
Change-Id: I54f34d5701c2b07e13ca0e76e51e152476b06306
Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Move configure_port_forwarding into configure_ovn_plugin

This patch is a follow-up of Iafb9e45520798b2a612192cfc6cca28501465862.

configure_port_forwarding was being checked/invoked from the wrong place
in neutron [0]. This patch moves it into its proper location:
configure_ovn_plugin in ovn_agent.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/750811

Change-Id: Ia02aa9e42ca76c7db90fc96cc39fc9e25c0227a9
Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>

[glance] Create non-client lib victoria branch

This creates the stable/victoria branch for any non-client libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on September 3.

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8
support in their later version.
Story: #2007865
Task: #40218

Closes-Bug: #1886298

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal
Change-Id: I0e4b1ce32bfaa199b58b95a34f0201c9162eef83

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints errors

This patch changes the lower-constraint requirements to make them
py3.8 compatible. See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1886298
cffi==1.14.0
greenlet==0.4.15
MarkupSafe==1.1.0
paramiko==2.7.1
PyYAML==3.13

Change-Id: I13501f3a0cd78c7ca8637b9b941216449be5980f
Partial-Bug: #1886298

[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-12 00:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-04-12 09:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/651944/1 : FAILURE in 7m 09s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-12 09:37:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for looking at this :) I've removed the pep8 dependency from this in [1] so I guess this can be abandoned if/when that merges?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/651553"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-04-12 10:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-30402 : SUCCESS in 1h 27m 54s'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-13 00:19:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks for looking at this :) I've removed the pep8 dependency from
 > this in [1] so I guess this can be abandoned if/when that merges?
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/651553

Sure.  This was fallout from that change when Eric noticed that it was needed.

If 651553 removes the import and is going to be ready soon that's all good this was mostly to keep that change clean.

Fell free to fix this or abandon it at will.  The jsonschema change is the important one"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-10 14:07:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We no longer explicitly use pep8 so this is no longer necessary \o/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 00:16:49.000000000', 'message': "Add pep8 to test-requirements

As we explicitly use pep8:

 ---
 [tony@thor nova]$ git grep -Ei 'import pep8'
 nova/hacking/checks.py:20:import pep8
 nova/tests/unit/test_hacking.py:19:import pep8
 ---

we shouldn't rely on transitive deps to get it

Change-Id: I307d9acade42607c607e66da8fa846c9a279a609
"}]
commit_message:
Add pep8 to test-requirements

As we explicitly use pep8:

 ---
 [tony@thor nova]$ git grep -Ei 'import pep8'
 nova/hacking/checks.py:20:import pep8
 nova/tests/unit/test_hacking.py:19:import pep8
 ---

we shouldn't rely on transitive deps to get it

Change-Id: I307d9acade42607c607e66da8fa846c9a279a609

commit_message:
Bump pylint version to support python3.8

pylint 2.2.2 which we currently use does not support python 3.8 [1].

Let's use a newer version of pylint.

pylint now declares strict versions for astroid and isort,
so we do not need to manage them in our test-requirements.txt.

All new checks are disabled temporarily. Let's visit them later and
judge whether we disable them permanently one by one.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/2737

Change-Id: I106b250e632305365aaab4d881c9ba5ea93505b3

commit_message:
libvirt: Virtuozzo containers config drive support

This change is implementing config drive support for Virtuozzo
containers. A config drive is added into guest's xml as an
additional filesystem element as follows:

    <filesystem type='file' accessmode='passthrough'>
      <driver type='ploop' format='ploop'/>
      <source file='/vz/stack/data/nova/instances/UUID/disk.config'/>
      <target dir='/var/lib/cloud/seed/config_drive'/>
    </filesystem>

where /vz/stack/data/nova/instances/UUID/disk.config is a path to a
directory where ploop image resides. A target directory path
/var/lib/cloud/seed/config_drive is a path where cloud-init looks
for configuration info.

Change-Id: I2810237dcc1c21ac00ce5d0e220224597810e194
Implements: blueprint config-drive-support-for-virtuozzo-containers

We need to tell the operator to remove the service from Keystone or to do it automatically ourselves. Also, needs a release note.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-09-09 17:06:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Pierre has a point; I'm a bit worried we have no policy set regarding removals"}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-09-10 01:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2020-09-10 03:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

agree， should remove endpoints from keystone'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2020-09-10 03:50:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> agree， should remove endpoints from keystone

i think add a task to remove endpoints is better'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-09-10 08:09:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

We still register the logging endpoint separately, even though it now defaults to the Monasca API. The Monasca API can run in 'log only', or 'metric only' mode, which is controlled by configuration. An advanced user may for example have a dedicated Elasticsearch cluster, and could deploy the Monasca API in 'log only' mode on that cluster. That is the idea behind continuing to register both endpoints.

Thanks for the submission though - the reason this exists probably isn't clear, and won't be used by most users. I should improve the documentation."}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-09-10 14:04:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

I understand the problem, I'm just not sure that this is the solution. Ideally, we'd report the NUMA usage correctly, conflicts and all (so if 2 VMs are conflictually pinned to CPU 2, we'd report CPU 2 as used). I'm not sure just essentially skipping that part is correct (though I guess it's technically better than what we currently have). I'll need to look at this in more depth."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-13 12:58:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

i have not dug into this yet by my inital feeling is that skiping
updating the resouce usage of numa resuces could lead to OOM event if it allows addtional instance to be spawned on the host.

i have not looked at how we are handeling cpu/mempage claims to confirm but if skiping this would result in under reporting the amount of either resouce that is in use it is not safe to do so.

i think we need to properly mark the resouces as used and log an error to notify the admin that the instance pinning has been violated.

this should only happen if you live migration a pinned instance or if you modifed the vcpu_pin_set to remove cores that were in use by vms on a host.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-10 14:02:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I think this is a duplicate of #1879878. Closing as such.'}]

commit_message:
RT keep report usage in case CPUPinning conflict

Resource Tracker fails to update usage when there
is CPUPinning conflict. At this situation, compare
with not report, report usage but only numa-topology
not that accurate would be better.

Change-Id: Ie5ff584190b96dfb01b3d30404690b281d5171d0
Closes-Bug: #1829349
Signed-off-by: Leehom Li <feli5@cisco.com>

As Stephen noted, it is still not correct commit message'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-01-25 00:21:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This change to the *lower* constraint is not needed, as the lower constraint for oslo.config is 6.1.0, which requires rfc3986 0.3.1 [1].

Even if the lower constraint for oslo.config was upgraded, I'm pretty sure we wouldn't need this change. The nova project's lower-constraints dictates the minimum level *nova* needs. When you install, a minimum version of oslo.config that requires a higher level of rfc3986 than what's in lower-constraints.txt will cause the higher level to be installed.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/6.1.0/lower-constraints.txt#L40"}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2019-01-29 06:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I agree that this patch is not necessary.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2020-04-11 12:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Takashi Natsume with the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-10 13:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
oslo.config==6.8.0 requires rfc3986>=1.2.0 and requirements project had made rfc3986==1.2.0 in upper-constraints.txt,so modify it .

Change-Id: Ia23e9f6f95462e763f0d8bca3f66dae6df7df0ed

commit_message:
Clean up tox.ini and document zuul.yaml settings

I tried to remove --sitepacakges and the gate failed
so I added comment and in the .zuul.yaml so future people
will understand why.

I Updated the tox.ini environment description so if someone
does a tox -av it will list all command supportted and a
small description of what

While dcoumenting the zuul.yaml I noticed that I made
patrole-reader a job and I feel that we should also
have it as a gate.

I also saw that extension and multi-node non-voting jobs
where missing reader versions so I added them.

Change-Id: I7b8e4c06ece6b32cab4d7238d0bc250334a3adb3

commit_message:
sphinx-feature-classification 1.1.0

This release adds support for parallel building of documentation and
removes/makes optional some unnecessary openstack'y dependencies.

Change-Id: I017b0a3be5a39904ea564f092627bccd50ee48ab
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create starter-kit:kubernetes-in-virt tag

For the benefit of prospective users wanting a multitenant cloud base
upon which to run Kubernetes clusters in virtual machines, recommend a
minimal starting set of OpenStack services to provide it.

Change-Id: Id953502a410a175cc222371d52d3e03b88278495

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-16 16:26:41.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo_profile_tasks: print out nodes which failed and were ignored

Within the context of max_fail_percentage, we want to improve UX by
displaying which nodes failed to be deployed but were ignored, probably
because max_fail_percentage was set to a value which matches the play
results.

e.g. we tolerate 10% of compute node failures and two nodes failed
without blocking the whole deployment; the callback will display the
following message:

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Summary Information ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Elapsed Time: 0:45:36.997 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
(...)
~~~~~~~ Failed node(s) within max fail percentage range: 2 ~~~~~
 This or these node(s) failed to deploy: compute23, compute 45

Change-Id: Ib337ea6c9c54a38cf11d021bce4edaf60e9928bd

commit_message:
Add a new callback: tripleo_states

Summary: print out nodes which failed and were ignored

Within the context of max_fail_percentage, we want to improve UX by
displaying which nodes failed to be deployed or were unreachable, probably
because max_fail_percentage was set to a value which matches the play
results.

e.g. we tolerate 10% of compute node failures and two nodes failed
without blocking the whole deployment; the callback will display the
following message:

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Summary Information ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Elapsed Time: 0:45:36.997 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
(...)
~~~~~~~ Number of nodes which did not deploy successfuly: 2 ~~~~
This or these node(s) failed to deploy: compute23, compute 45

In the future, this callback will be useful to improve state
informations that are displayed by Ansible when it's done running.

Change-Id: Ib337ea6c9c54a38cf11d021bce4edaf60e9928bd

commit_message:
[WIP] Run Glance Ceph functional tests as part of gate

The ceph-osd charm gate already consumes Glance to confirm that
the ceph-osd relation handling code works. Glance gate does not
have Ceph in the bundles, so we return the favor and execute their
Ceph tests here.

Change-Id: I650e2f1eb14e34d3094e970cf54031da8892091b
Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/398

Final victoria client lib release for the September 10 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave a -1 if we

commit_message:
Release final python-aodhclient for victoria

Final victoria client lib release for the September 10 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave a -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to loand,
then update with a better commit hash to use for the release when
ready.

Patches with no response will be approved by September 14.

Change-Id: Iee5c63c48bfca2a8dad3621a5f57b19258db720a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
functional: Provide default 'host_info' for '_get_connection'

No point in using the exact same value in multiple places. While we're
here, we also provide the ability to specify a QEMU version in addition
to a libvirt version.

Change-Id: I0c4f50ddd34d367f3c070a069c1d9b1da3869ce4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
virt: Highlight soon-to-be-unused driver APIs

These are all XenAPI-only APIs and can be removed in the near future
when that driver goes away. Highlight this fact now.

Change-Id: I04f6bd4000f58b9da2e4165aa2d623e795845d4e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add sample extra-aucs file

The Extra-AUCs file can be used by people to nominate themselves or
others for AUC status that is not captured through one of the
automated criteria.

Change-Id: Icdb2904de684706e660a367da31e27eb4253c7b3

Sync Sphinx requirement

Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I0024c856fc0ae42d922f77862763caac83d16e09

[{'created': '2018-02-13 08:10:30.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/ dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I93d5a15946f5962bf7580f82838396ac3ebe0c3c

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I93d5a15946f5962bf7580f82838396ac3ebe0c3c

commit_message:
Add more informative debug logs to agent processes

This patch adds some more debug logs into agent processes, so that
we can observe their behavior more in detail.
Also, this patch removes some detailed informations like pids from
responses returned to gateway/runtime, because gateway/runtime doesn't
require the details of agent behavior.

Change-Id: I2fd9998966120c46414e607b94ce03bee884e11f

commit_message:
Remove dragonflow

Dragonflow was removed from governance in 2018 and is now being retired.
This cleans up references to dragonflow jobs and configuration.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015600.html

Change-Id: Ie990da4e68e82d998768fa0c047cca4cccd59915
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Stop install unnecessary packages when run tox -e releasenotes

requirements.txt is unnecessary when run tox -e releasenotes,
releasenotes relative stuffs is in doc/requirements.txt, this ps to
remove the requirements.txt from tox.ini and reuse [docs] deps

Change-Id: Ia6c51f9ffe1257f16e9bd55fe21cc832b634cbf3

commit_message:
Update grenade job to run one smoke test

With the addition of many new test permutations, the grenade job
is taking more time to run.
Previously grenade ran one smoke test to test basic traffic.
This patch updated the grenade job to run the basic http traffic
test.
This patch also restores the grenade job to voting status.

Change-Id: Ic0446994ffac130c632624a37482393f00fe8714

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-10 09:45:56.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iac237385e10eca481ba9850ac95acbce060b379e
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iac237385e10eca481ba9850ac95acbce060b379e

[{'created': '2020-09-09 17:55:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the lower-const job by bumping cffi to 1.14.0

The move to focal for the lower-constraint job causes cffi to fail.
This patch bumps the lower for cffi to 1.14.0 to fix it.

Change-Id: I95cc182a2dbcb2ea872e822ce9372bf5d7df63bd
'}, {'created': '2020-09-09 18:19:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the lower-constraints job for focal

The move to focal for the lower-constraint job causes cffi to fail.
This patch bumps the lower for cffi to 1.14.0 to fix it.
It also bumps cryptography to 2.8 for python3.8 support.

Change-Id: I95cc182a2dbcb2ea872e822ce9372bf5d7df63bd
'}, {'created': '2020-09-09 18:25:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the lower-constraints job for focal

The move to focal for the lower-constraint job causes cffi to fail.
This patch bumps the lower for cffi to 1.14.0 to fix it.
It also bumps cryptography to 3.0 for python3.8 support and pkcs12.

Change-Id: I95cc182a2dbcb2ea872e822ce9372bf5d7df63bd
'}, {'created': '2020-09-09 18:31:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the lower-constraints job for focal

The move to focal for the lower-constraint job causes cffi to fail.
This patch bumps the lower for cffi to 1.14.0 to fix it.
It also bumps cryptography to 3.0 for python3.8 support and pkcs12.
Bumps pyOpenSSL to resolve a python3.x issue and to support OpenSSL 1.1.1.

Change-Id: I95cc182a2dbcb2ea872e822ce9372bf5d7df63bd
'}, {'created': '2020-09-09 19:17:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the lower-constraints job for focal

The move to focal for the tox jobs has raised issues with package
versions supporting python 3.8.
This patch bumps the version for the following packages:
PyMySQL==0.8.0
pyroute2==0.5.13
SQLAlchemy==1.2.19
cffi==1.14.0
cryptography==3.0
pyOpenSSL==19.1.0

Change-Id: I95cc182a2dbcb2ea872e822ce9372bf5d7df63bd
'}, {'created': '2020-09-09 19:40:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the lower-constraints job for focal

The move to focal for the tox jobs has raised issues with package
versions supporting python 3.8.
This patch bumps the version for the following packages:
PyMySQL==0.8.0
pyroute2==0.5.13
SQLAlchemy==1.2.19
cffi==1.14.0
cryptography==3.0
pyOpenSSL==19.1.0

commit_message:
Fix the lower-constraints job for focal

The move to focal for the tox jobs has raised issues with package
versions supporting python 3.8.
This patch bumps the version for the following packages:
PyMySQL==0.8.0
pyroute2==0.5.13
SQLAlchemy==1.2.19
cffi==1.14.0
cryptography==3.0
pyOpenSSL==19.1.0
oslo.db==8.30
oslo.messaging==12.4.0

This patch makes the grenade job non-voting as there is a chain
of gate fix patches required to fully fix all of the issues.

Change-Id: I95cc182a2dbcb2ea872e822ce9372bf5d7df63bd

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5e046da4184ed6ab8971666e05706c840541d5b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-12 14:03:48.000000000', 'message': 'Allow service actions to be overridden

In order to allow child classes to use other means of controlling
service lifetime, this change introduces methods that call
systemd/upstart via charm-helpers by default but allow for something
else to be used in overrides.

The example use-case in question is the use of crm tools to restart
services:

crm_resource --restart --wait --node <node-name>

Which will restart a resource on a given node if it is running there or
return ENXIO otherwise.

Change-Id: Ifb16f6743296a1ef6dcb212cad517afd57270f7f
Closes-Bug: #1891160
'}]
commit_message:
Allow service actions to be overridden

In order to allow child classes to use other means of controlling
service lifetime, this change introduces methods that call
systemd/upstart via charm-helpers by default but allow for something
else to be used in overrides.

The example use-case in question is the use of crm tools to restart
services:

crm_resource --restart --wait --node <node-name>

Which will restart a resource on a given node if it is running there or
return ENXIO otherwise.

Change-Id: Ifb16f6743296a1ef6dcb212cad517afd57270f7f
Closes-Bug: #1891160

commit_message:
Add support volume local cache

Use volume type extra spec 'cacheable' to identify if a volume can be
cached or not. If it is set to '<is> True', then it means the volume can
be cached in compute node locally via caching software (e.g. open-cas)

open-cas: https://open-cas.github.io/
Nova Spec: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689070/
Cinder Spec: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/684556/

Change-Id: I61a795f4ab2c4208094245bd577c39de1b35d6ef
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Support multiple NFS shares for bind mounts

Rebuild to pickup changes to charms.openstack classes to support
use of nfs-shares configuration options containing multiple
comma separated nfs shares.

Update description of action to reflect this change.

Change-Id: I64ac3a7c2fa2f1662db055227ea2b885f9c2564f
Closes-Bug: 1894817
Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/410

commit_message:
Support multiple NFS shares for bind mounts

Rebuild to pickup changes to charms.openstack classes to support
use of nfs-shares configuration options containing multiple
comma separated nfs shares.

Update description of action to reflect this change.

Change-Id: If03387fa06ecf546a640b20415497800f7ef7d9d
Closes-Bug: 1894817
Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/410

commit_message:
Use UUID as vif and network_id in vif tests

Later patches depend on these more realistic test data. Also a faulty
test case, test_compute.ComputeAPITestCase.test_attach_interface_failed
has been caught and fixed.

Part of blueprint sriov-interface-attach-detach

Change-Id: I4bdd25458998ca1a9fb411dfd015684a6d3fcfa3

commit_message:
[Glusterfs] Fix delete share, mount point not disconnected

When we delete the shared instance, in addition to erasing the data
in the share, we should disconnect the client's mount point to
prevent the data from being written in.

Closes-Bug: #1886010
Change-Id: I7a334fb895669cc807a288e6aefe62154a89a7e4
(cherry picked from commit 9d44ba0b6a2d20be6158ff667ff3b81de31f5cad)
(cherry picked from commit 4f2e400a6bcbcb79103354a76211455f9e7c605a)
(cherry picked from commit d9e6743ba5b45d75212fd9a247d3f2ec60958f04)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I0c5a81d6c95fa6437ac739e048a3983c27ab71c7
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate tox based testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40194
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738328/

Closes-Bug: #1886298

Change-Id: Ib0f84e8c3815be48bca0ae8d4fe15a56b5256c20

commit_message:
Add Inspur FPGA driver

Please see the test report in https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Cyborg/TestReport/InspurFPGA
This patch implemented Inspur FPGA driver in Cyborg. Currently we don't
support program with this card by Cyborg, the operator can bind the card
to guest and use it in guest, so BSP data reported is ignored now.

The spec is already merged. Please see:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cyborg-specs/specs/victoria/approved/inspur-fpga-driver-proposal.html

Story: 2007772
Task: 39997

Change-Id: I7cc3482a4a6ac6fb0ca6965b7ce18bc37b122f63

'}, {'created': '2020-03-10 12:05:57.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor error messages.

Error messages can come from different projects(cinder, keystone,
nova, etc.),but we are currently catching all the exceptions and
return a generic error message and it hard for the user to determine
the source of error. Horizon team decided to add a collapse-able box
for error messages which shows the detailed error message on the
horizon UI during shanghai summit[1]. This patch do the same.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/horizon-u-ptg#110

Change-Id: If0bd24540562b8f1330ac6cb7db5f1d354e1d1b7

commit_message:
Refactor error messages.

Error messages can come from different projects(cinder, keystone,
nova, etc.),but we are currently catching all the exceptions and
return a generic error message and it hard for the user to determine
the source of error. Horizon team decided to add a collapse-able box
for error messages which shows the detailed error message on the
horizon UI during shanghai summit[1]. This patch do the same.

Partially-Implements blueprint refactor-error-messages

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/horizon-u-ptg#110

Change-Id: If0bd24540562b8f1330ac6cb7db5f1d354e1d1b7

subject: Combined cherry-pick to allow TCIB to run config-less
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-09-08 20:22:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-09-09 18:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 20:22:56.000000000', 'message': "Combined cherry-pick to allow TCIB to run config-less

1) Allow the container build tools to run config-less

This change allows the container build tools to run without a
provided configuration file. The container configuration file
still in service was derived from our old kolla implementation
which no longer needs to exist. The build process will now
simply walk the build path and build all containers found when
a configuration file is not defined or present. Logging has
been added to inform the user of the tools discoveries which
should provide a nice user experience when running container
builds.

In the event a container configuration file is used, the tools
will now ensure all dependent images are inherently part of the
build preparation.

Tests have been updated to ensure that the client is operational
in both a config and config-less situation.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4d23eee41e86cd52c3d6c62e86e10daec582213e)

2) Update dependency logic to correctly index parents

This change adjusts the parent indexer so that it will correctly
discover base images that maybe be implicitly required.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f081d6afd630aabcf9e827d77a4b2f4a82097f81)

These changes improve the TCIB user experience and ensure we're future
proofing our container build tools.

Change-Id: Ibadef29b24232544dbc8cfc0b5dc8d0238d09ed6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Combined cherry-pick to allow TCIB to run config-less

1) Allow the container build tools to run config-less

This change allows the container build tools to run without a
provided configuration file. The container configuration file
still in service was derived from our old kolla implementation
which no longer needs to exist. The build process will now
simply walk the build path and build all containers found when
a configuration file is not defined or present. Logging has
been added to inform the user of the tools discoveries which
should provide a nice user experience when running container
builds.

In the event a container configuration file is used, the tools
will now ensure all dependent images are inherently part of the
build preparation.

Tests have been updated to ensure that the client is operational
in both a config and config-less situation.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4d23eee41e86cd52c3d6c62e86e10daec582213e)

2) Update dependency logic to correctly index parents

This change adjusts the parent indexer so that it will correctly
discover base images that maybe be implicitly required.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f081d6afd630aabcf9e827d77a4b2f4a82097f81)

These changes improve the TCIB user experience and ensure we're future
proofing our container build tools.

Change-Id: Ibadef29b24232544dbc8cfc0b5dc8d0238d09ed6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-09 08:28:49.000000000', 'message': "Convert all of the fedora28 container usage to CentOS8

This change moves all of the fedora28 container images to centos8 to
ensure we're maximizing coverage in all of our roles with OS images that
represent real deployments. While fedora28 was useful to exercise RHEL8
code path's while there was no RHEL/CentOS8 container image, we can now
use the upstream CentOS8 image ensuring we're getting a true,
representative, environment.

The following molecule test has been moved to non-voting as it is
facing some issues. A follow up patch will try to fix them ASAP.

- check_network_gateway (facing an issue when Ansible is trying to
  discover the python interpreter used in CentOS8 Docker Image)

Related-Bug: #1894882

commit_message:
Convert all of the fedora28 container usage to CentOS8

This change moves all of the fedora28 container images to centos8 to
ensure we're maximizing coverage in all of our roles with OS images that
represent real deployments. While fedora28 was useful to exercise RHEL8
code path's while there was no RHEL/CentOS8 container image, we can now
use the upstream CentOS8 image ensuring we're getting a true,
representative, environment.

The following molecule test has been moved to non-voting as it is
facing some issues. A follow up patch will try to fix them ASAP.

- check_network_gateway (facing an issue when Ansible is trying to
  discover the python interpreter used in CentOS8 Docker Image)

Related-Bug: #1894882
Change-Id: I02f68b78fdf73a60443d8ea5d2dcb46e5ad67e25
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4fc31e06dc71bd321a166d06e54d1bc9106d4874)
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix TLS support in openstack-exporter osclient

This change updates the TLS support in openstack-exporter to handle
when TLS is not enabled.

Change-Id: Ia9b749e77f49bf0246a03a576d34501304097694

commit_message:
Remove some useless swob.Request attr setting

None of it was getting passed through to the WSGI env, so it had no
effect on anything.

Change-Id: Id0b9ea0b0d1cd03bb75233953abadbb17fadc426

commit_message:
Fix warning function name

The correct name is warning() not warn.

2020-09-09T12:30:18.621315870+00:00 stderr F <13>Sep  9 12:30:18
puppet-user: Error: Evaluation Error: Unknown function: 'warn'. (file:
/etc/puppet/modules/nova/manifests/compute/ironic.pp, line: 30, column:
5) on node standalone.localdomain

Closes-Bug: #1895027
Change-Id: I4453b29efd46e26cc46653456347b54dadd6706c

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

(2 comments)

Definitely needs a test to reproduce/poke the failure and validate the fix. I'm quite sure that just making the object silently paper over the fact that those attributes aren't set in the object is not the right solution here. If there's some reason they're not set by the sender because of some scenario (like a specific vif driver) then the caller should probably not be calling this method expecting to get back a vif with the right values in it. Worse, it could be some compatibility thing where we've introduced a change that broke the RPC expectations across a call. Having a test will help suss that out."}, {'account_id': 32220, 'date': '2020-08-17 18:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-21 13:00:21.000000000', 'message': "fixes broken shared live migration of a vm with a vif aka Bug #1888395

target side calls get_dest_vif member during initialization
stage of migration on a VIFMigrateData instance prepared locally.
there is nobody to set the vif_type attribute value to that
instance earlier thus the migration fails with an exception at the
target.
fortunatelly, the value is available in the source_vif object which
is set definitely because of the test inside the get_dest_vif function.
result value of the function is a deep copy of the source_vif object
then several attributes are replaced with the values from the
VIFMigrateData instance.
let's skip accesses to unset VIFMigrateData instance attributes
and rest with the values from the source_vif.

Change-Id: Ia00277ac8a68a635db85f9e0ce2c6d8df396e0d8

"}, {'created': '2020-08-21 00:30:34.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Set migrate_data.vifs only when using multiple port bindings

In the rocky cycle nova was enhanced to support the multiple
port binding live migration workflow when neutron supports
the binding-extended api extension.
When the migration_data object was extended to support
multiple port bindings, populating the vifs field was used
as a sentiel to indicate that the new workflow should
be used.

In the train release
I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
(SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support)
broke the semantics of the migrate_data object by
ucontionally populating the vifs field

This change restores the rocky semantics which are depened
on is several parts of the code base by only condtionally
populating vifs if neutron support multiple port bindings.

TODO: Add unit tests and fix mocking in failing tests
TODO: Add reproduce functional test.
Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>
Change-Id: Ia00277ac8a68a635db85f9e0ce2c6d8df396e0d8
Closes-Bug: #1888395

commit_message:
Set migrate_data.vifs only when using multiple port bindings

In the rocky cycle nova was enhanced to support the multiple
port binding live migration workflow when neutron supports
the binding-extended API extension.
When the migration_data object was extended to support
multiple port bindings, populating the vifs field was used
as a sentinel to indicate that the new workflow should
be used.

In the train release
I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
(SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support)
broke the semantics of the migrate_data object by
unconditionally populating the vifs field

This change restores the rocky semantics, which are depended
on by several parts of the code base, by only conditionally
populating vifs if neutron supports multiple port bindings.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>
Change-Id: Ia00277ac8a68a635db85f9e0ce2c6d8df396e0d8
Closes-Bug: #1888395

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria
messages: [{'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2020-09-10 01:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-09 17:41:26.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic5b9eea8773f93ce1ad0589bf7f7b16b411be64c
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic5b9eea8773f93ce1ad0589bf7f7b16b411be64c

commit_message:
Exit gracefully on Ctrl-C

If we receive SIGINT, exit gracefully: run the clean_up method; don't
print a stacktrace; exit with error code 130 (128 + SIGINT).

Change-Id: I77687133d5482912523814a28e42f4f3a1a146d5
Story: 2008124
Task: 40846

commit_message:
Test file_backed_memory instance resize/live migration operation

This test will run the resize, block live migration and
also validate in parallel that the memory backing element
source type and access mode confguration are accurately
reflecting i.e file and shared respectively.

Also this will set/unset the nova.conf file_backed_memory
and ram_allocation_ratio params and restart the nova-compute
service on compute host.

Note: currently this will run on the environment
with exact two compute hosts.

Change-Id: I99fa385ca196fe668f5bd3b11541c28f4b6dea19

commit_message:
Stop install unnecessary packages when run tox -edocs

the requirements.txt is unnecessary when run tox -e docs
docs relative stuffs is in doc/requirements.txt, this ps to
remove the requirements.txt from tox.ini

(2 comments)

This Ansible module uses the same algorithm found in this tripleo-common workbook [1] but also computes the vCPU to OSD ratio dynamically based on hardware found in Ironic. The original in Mistral always defaulted this ratio to 1.



[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/workbooks/derive_params_formulas.yaml#L578'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-08-31 22:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-31 23:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-31 23:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Also, if this is used not only in tests but in module itself then this should be added to requirements.txt instead of molecule-requirements.txt 

I might be wrong about this. It seems that PyYaml should be installed as a part of requirement by python-heatclient, so the problem seems to be that the requirement.txt is not used in molecule jobs ? Then I think it makes sense to add it to molecule-requirements.txt .'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-08-31 23:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-08-31 23:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

You'll need https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749416 to test this locally"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-02 23:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-03 00:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-03 12:43:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Patch Set 19 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-03 18:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

FYI molecule is testing the hci derived parameters module using the mock ironic data. 

- Click tripleo-ansible-centos-8-molecule-tripleo_derived_parameters
- Logs
- reports.html  (raw)
- Then click the green "pass" button to open up the playbook run

You should see something like this which I just pasted from it:

    TASK [tripleo_derived_parameters : Show HCI derived paramters results] *********
    ok: [centos8] =>
      msg:
        changed: false
        derived_parameters:
          ComputeHCIParameters:
            NovaCPUAllocationRatio: 1.0
            NovaReservedHostMemory: 54000
        failed: false
        message: |-
          Derived Parameters results
           Inputs:
           - Total host RAM in GB: 256
           - Total host vCPUs: 2
           - Ceph OSDs per host: 1
           - Average guest memory size in GB: 2
           - Average guest CPU utilization: 50%
    
           Outputs:
           - number of guests allowed based on memory = 98
           - number of guest vCPUs allowed = 2
           - nova.conf reserved_host_memory = 54000 MB
           - nova.conf cpu_allocation_ratio = 1.00
    
          Compare "guest vCPUs allowed" to "guests allowed based on memory"
          for actual guest count.
    
          OSD type distribution:
            HDDs 1 | Non-NVMe SSDs 0 | NVMe SSDs 0
            vCPU to OSD ratio: 1

Here's an example

https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_400/746595/20/check/tripleo-ansible-centos-8-molecule-tripleo_derived_parameters/400725e/reports.html'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-03 18:45:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)

Aside from the molecule and unit tests I also confirmed this work in my environment deployment.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-03 18:56:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:
