commit_message:
Introduce module tripleo_derive_hci_parameters

Derive HCI parameters with an Ansible module instead of
a Mistral workflow.

Also adds the cli-derive-local-hci-parameters.yml playbook
which may be run before a deployment to generate a Heat
environment file to use as input to a deployment.

Story: 2007419
Task: 40710
Change-Id: I6ea9686a98a98c1fcb8d06f44eac830129fd74b0

subject: Derive HCI reseverved host memory without average guest workload
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-08 18:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-08 20:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-08 20:34:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In addition to the CI tests, I tested this on a real deployment too and it works.

The following:

openstack overcloud plan export $STACK
tar xf $STACK.tar.gz
grep derived -A 10 plan-environment.yaml

Produced the following as expected.

derived_parameters:
  ComputeHCIParameters:
    NovaReservedHostMemory: 5120
description: 'Default Deployment plan

  '
environments:
- path: overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml
- path: environments/containers-default-parameters.yaml
- path: user-environment.yaml
name: overcloud

Also, using ansible to run the following inside the nova_compute container shows expected results:

'grep reserved_host_memory_mb /etc/nova/nova.conf'

overcloud-computehci-1 | CHANGED | rc=0 >>
reserved_host_memory_mb=5120
overcloud-computehci-0 | CHANGED | rc=0 >>
reserved_host_memory_mb=5120
overcloud-computehci-2 | CHANGED | rc=0 >>
reserved_host_memory_mb=5120"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-09-09 18:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-09-09 20:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 18:54:57.000000000', 'message': 'Derive HCI reseverved host memory without average guest workload

Add new option to tripleo_derive_hci_parameters module so that
if both the average_guest_cpu_utilization_percentage and the
average_guest_memory_size_in_mb are not passed, then a simpler
calculation is performed which computes the required memory for
the Ceph OSDs.

It is preferable for the user to pass the expected workload but
if this value is unknown it is still better to at least reserve
the bare minimum in memory for the OSDs so that they do not get
shutdown from an OOM error.

Change-Id: I68ad3783d3e0bf47fd63ab79f6ea0b0655c751c1
'}, {'created': '2020-09-08 20:23:05.000000000', 'message': 'Derive HCI reseverved host memory without average guest workload

Add new option to tripleo_derive_hci_parameters module so that
if both the average_guest_cpu_utilization_percentage and the
average_guest_memory_size_in_mb are not passed, then a simpler
calculation is performed which computes the required memory for
the Ceph OSDs.

It is preferable for the user to pass the expected workload but
if this value is unknown it is still better to at least reserve
the bare minimum in memory for the OSDs so that they do not get
shutdown from an OOM error.

Change-Id: I68ad3783d3e0bf47fd63ab79f6ea0b0655c751c1
'}]
commit_message:
Derive HCI reseverved host memory without average guest workload

Add new option to tripleo_derive_hci_parameters module so that
if both the average_guest_cpu_utilization_percentage and the
average_guest_memory_size_in_mb are not passed, then a simpler
calculation is performed which computes the required memory for
the Ceph OSDs.

It is preferable for the user to pass the expected workload but
if this value is unknown it is still better to at least reserve
the bare minimum in memory for the OSDs so that they do not get
shutdown from an OOM error.

Change-Id: I68ad3783d3e0bf47fd63ab79f6ea0b0655c751c1
